meanings.definition: A person or thing that fails to meet expectations or is unsuccessful.
meanings.sent1: The team had many washouts who couldn't score any points.
meanings.sent2: The project was a washout due to poor planning.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show had a washout performer who kept forgetting their lines.
meanings.sent4: The new product launch was a washout, failing to attract any customers.
meanings.sent5: The movie was a washout with critics, receiving only negative reviews.

meanings.definition: The act of washing out or cleaning something.
meanings.sent1: She used a strong detergent for the washouts of the dirty clothes.
meanings.sent2: The washouts of the paintbrush were done carefully to remove all the color.
meanings.sent3: The washouts of the dishes after dinner were quick and efficient.
meanings.sent4: The car washouts were thorough, leaving the vehicle sparkling clean.
meanings.sent5: The washouts of the windows were done with a streak-free cleaner for a clear view.

meanings.definition: A channel or gully created by the action of water.
meanings.sent1: The heavy rain caused washouts in the dirt road, making it difficult to drive.
meanings.sent2: The river formed deep washouts along its banks over time.
meanings.sent3: The kids enjoyed playing in the small washouts left by the rain in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The hiker had to navigate around the washouts on the trail caused by recent storms.
meanings.sent5: The construction crew had to fill in the washouts to prevent erosion near the building site.
